title: German Hamburgers (Frikadellen) Recipe
description: This frikadellen recipe with ground pork and beef, onion, parsley, egg, and hot paprika makes a batch of delicious pan-fried German meat patties.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German German Hamburgers (Frikadellen) 4.5 (104) 91 Reviews 9 Photos Frikadellen, the original hamburger, are served like a flattened meatball with string beans and salad. I also like to use this recipe to make Swedish meatballs (but omit the paprika). My aunt in Hamburg, Germany, taught me this recipe, and I've been making it ever since. Serve with steamed string beans and tossed salad. Or serve on a kaiser roll with lettuce, tomato, pickled cucumbers, finely sliced deep-fried onions, and curry ketchup. Submitted by Amy Updated on November 15, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 9 9 9 9 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 kaiser roll ⅔ pound ground beef ⅓ pound ground pork 1 onion, finely chopped ¼ cup chopped fresh parsley 1 large egg 1 teaspoon Hungarian hot paprika (Optional) salt and ground black pepper to taste Directions Soak kaiser roll in a medium bowl of water for 10 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess water; crumble into a large bowl. Add ground meats, onion, parsley, egg, paprika, salt, and black pepper to crumbled roll; mix until well blended. Shape mixture into large flattened meatballs. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Fry meatballs in the hot skillet until browned and no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a patty should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 186 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 272 Calories 16g Fat 9g Carbs 22g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 272 % Daily Value * Total Fat 16g 21% Saturated Fat 6g 30% Cholesterol 117mg 39% Sodium 138mg 6% Total Carbohydrate 9g 3% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 2g Protein 22g 45% Vitamin C 8mg 8% Calcium 40mg 3% Iron 3mg 14% Potassium 351mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of German Hamburgers (Frikadellen) 01 of 09 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 09 Photo by  John Sherrill 09/09/2024 Easy to make. Brought me back to my childhood. Even my daughter, who is not a fan of onion, liked these!!! 03 of 09 Photo by  MickeyRaye 04/13/2021 Yummy! Just like I remembered from Germany. 04 of 09 Photo by  kady frawley 09/27/2018 These actually came out AMAZING. I doubled the recipe. The rolls made the hamburgers so moist and delicious. I made a pan gravy to put on top of these. My kids are 3 and 5 and loved this! I couldn't believe how great they came out. Def going to make these often. Cheap and easy! And I also followed some advice of the reviews and breaded them as well!! Great decision. Added a crispiness to the patties. 05 of 09 Photo by  foodz 07/12/2018 06 of 09 Photo by  sharolyn 07/22/2017 07 of 09 Photo by  peg 08/05/2016 08 of 09 Photo by  Ulrike Kruger 02/15/2015 09 of 09 Photo by  BigShotsMom 02/28/2013 Frikadellen is one of my favorites at our local German restaurant. These are good but I am still on the hunt for the recipe with caraway seed. Thanks for sharing Amy. 1 You’ll Also Love Original Steak Tartare 16 Ratings Carne con Chile Rojo 15 Ratings German Schwenkbraten 25 Ratings Meat and Spinach Ravioli Filling 42 Ratings Filipino Fish Escabeche 3 Ratings Salmon Patties with Cornmeal and Crackers 147 Ratings Carly's Salmon En Papillote (In Paper) 42 Ratings Tuna Fish Patties 26 Ratings BBQ, Bacon, and Cheddar Meatballs 4 Ratings Klupskies (Polish Burgers) 37 Ratings Garlic Salmon 558 Ratings LaWanna's Mango Salsa on Tilapia Fillets 11 Ratings Vegetable Steamed Tilapia 3 Ratings Mom's Carne Guisada 66 Ratings Fajitas On A Stick 3 Ratings Parchment Baked Salmon 95 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Amy
instructions: Soak kaiser roll in a medium bowl of water for 10 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess water; crumble into a large bowl.;Add ground meats, onion, parsley, egg, paprika, salt, and black pepper to crumbled roll; mix until well blended. Shape mixture into large flattened meatballs.;Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Fry meatballs in the hot skillet until browned and no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a patty should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
